metadata.title: CVE-2017-16909 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An error related to the "LibRaw::panasonic_load_raw()" function(dcraw_common.cpp) in LibRaw versions prior to 0.18.6 can be exploited tocause a heap-based buffer overflow and subsequently cause a crash via aspecially crafted TIFF image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.18.8-1
libraw19 - 0.18.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libraw package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.18.8-1').
darktable package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
dcraw package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
rawtherapee package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
kodi package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
